question_text: Why can SAS controllers recognize SATA drives, but SATA controllers cannot use SAS drives?
answer_options: SAS drives use proprietary firmware that requires activation
SATA lacks the signaling and protocol support for SAS negotiation
SAS uses an outdated interface incompatible with modern buses
SATA power cables are incompatible with SAS connectors
correct_answer: SATA lacks the signaling and protocol support for SAS negotiation
explanation: SAS controllers are built to negotiate both SAS and SATA protocols. SATA controllers cannot interpret SAS signaling layers.
